primaryTopic.creator: http://editor.vocabs.ands.org.au/user/Natalia-Atkins
primaryTopic.dcSource: Australian Ocean Data Network Organisation Register
primaryTopic.definition: The Department of Water is the department of the Government of Western Australia that is responsible for management of Western Australia's water resources. The department provides information to industry, technical support and professional guidance to government on the status of water and the viability of new water source developments. It also issues licences for artesian groundwater wells throughout the State. (Courtesy of Wikipedia)
primaryTopic.isReplacedBy: Department of Water and Environmental Regulation (DWER), Western Australian Government

prefLabel._value: Department of Water (DoW), Western Australian Government

primaryTopic.scopeNote: Organisation no longer exists. Replaced by Department of Water and Environmental Regulation (DWER), Western Australian Government.
